nodes.title: ControlNet Important Note
widgets_values:
* Lower Strength and End Percent can lead to creative results which will reduce the original image look (Applicable in Softedge, Canny, Depth, and LineArt Pass)

* Greater Start percent around 0.3-0.5 tends to create a still image from the main prompt first and then an artifact character overlayed on it.  This Can be used for Abstract creation.

nodes.title: LCM Sampler Step and CFG
widgets_values:
Sampler Steps: Total Number of steps for ksampler. (Default value - 10) 

Sampler CFG - Use Between 2 - 9, Higher values causes artifacts, color noise, and weird backgrounds. Default value is 3. 
Use Lower 1-5 for Realistic Models and 3-7 for anime/cartoon.

LCM Lora Strength - 0.65 seems good, you can experiment with higher values, also balance CFG and steps.




-------------------------------

*When Background gets messy, use low cfg for good backgrounds.

*Value of cfg below 4 causes some faded look. You can experiment with 

1) LCM Lora Strength 
2) Sampler Steps
3) Sampler CFG 

All three are dependent on each other.

nodes.title: Prompt Note
widgets_values: Copy the same prompts, models, and loras from Raw Animation file.

nodes.title: AnimateDiff
widgets_values:
Model - motionModel_v01 and Temporaldiff-v1-animatediff was seen to produce best results.

Context Length to 16
----------------------------

motionModel_v01 - https://civitai.com/models/139237?modelVersionId=154097

Temporaldiff - https://huggingface.co/CiaraRowles/TemporalDiff/tree/main
* Temporal Diff can sometime give yellow tint to the final image, which can be fixed in post using curves>playing with the blue channel or use 2.5 - 4 cfg.


Feel free to test out other motion models.

nodes.title: Tutorial Link
widgets_values: Collection of Documented v3.0 Tutorials: https://www.patreon.com/collection/321458

nodes.title: #3 AnimateDiff Refiner LCM v3.0
widgets_values:
HOW TO USE: 

After you have rendered the raw Images from #2 Main Animation Raw file, 

1) Enter the Paths in Purple Directory Nodes of the Raw Images from #2 and Enter Masks Directory in Mask directory node.

2) Enter the Output path for saving the refined images.
3) Enter Batch Range 
4) Overlapping Frames - 0 is Default (Put 5 or 10 for overlapping cross fade technique between batches)
5) Skip Frame is 0 by default (Increase it after every batch) 
6) Batch Number Naming, increase it by 1 after every batch for organizing.
7) Refiner Upscale - Upscale value is 1.2 by default (Use 1.2 - 1.8 for best result for SD models) 
8) See the Red note below for changing the refiner settings.
9) Enter Prompts for more accuracy.  
10) Choose Model checkpoint you want to use for refiner.
11) Loras work as usual (Some of not compatible with animatediff, test it first with 10 frames)
*Caution: Don't Use Lora on same or full strength, which was already used for making Raw Animation, it will double up.

12) After Rendering all the frames then Open the #4 AnimateDIff Face Fix if your faces are not looking good. 

You can skip 12th step If faces are looking good or does not have faces in the video. 


Tip - Overlapping workflow can be applied here in refiner pass, Example how to use:

Total Input Image: 350

Batch 1:  Range - 100 | Overlapping : 10 | Skip - 0
Batch 2:  Range - 100 | Overlapping : 10 | Skip - 100
Batch 3:  Range - 100 | Overlapping : 10 | Skip - 200
Batch 4:  Range - 50  | Overlapping : 0  | Skip - 300 ( Overlap is 0 for the last batch to avoid extra repetition)

Total Output Images: 380 (350 images + (10 x 3 images for each batch))
In Post fade the extra overlapping frames for smooth transition.



Tip 2 : You can use this refine workflow again and again till you get your desired details, with same upscaling value or higher, just don't use overlapping frames technique in refiner phases else it will mess up the controlnet images, 
You can use overlapping technique in the last refiner phase.
Eg -
 
Raw phase > Refined Phase 1 > Refined Phase 2 > (Refined Phase 3 + Overlapping) 
like this
Just update the Input Raw Images directory to Refined phase x directory and Output Node every time. Â 

Tip 3: This Workflow Can also be used as vid2vid style conversion, Just Input the Original Source Frames as Raw Input and Denoise upto 0.6 - 0.7. 
And you can also the use these images for refiner again :D in Tip 2



________________________________________

Main Download Folder Link : https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1HoZxKUX7WAg7ObqP00R4oIv48sXCEryQ?usp=sharing
_________________________________________


Video Tutorials On my Channel - AnimateDiff ControlNet Animation
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCUoTFmdvUaNQe3P2Rgwx0yQ


Node Workflow By 
Jerry Davos

nodes.title: HigheRes Fix | Detail Enhancer | AD Macro Motion
widgets_values:
Inject Additional Refiner Noise - Use value 0 - 1 (It enhances the minute details, use with add details lora)

Refiner Upscale - It upscales the image - (value around 1.2 - 1.6 is good, above 1.6 no change is observed)
(Default Value - 1.2 which is good)
--------------------------------------------
*Start Refiner from nth step: It's an alternative to Denoising Technique, which mimics the denoiser. Default is 5. 

Refiner from nth Step Theory:
 
For Total Sampler Steps of 10 - 

Value 1 will mean denoise value 1.0
Value 5 will mean denoise value 0.5
Value 10 will mean denoise value 0

and like so, it is dependent on sampler steps.
----------------------------------------------


Detail Enhancer - It injects noise in the model, use up to max value of 20 - Higer values cause micro details into morphing/sliding. (Default value is 2) 

AD Macro Motion - AnimateDiff motion of Background Elements is controlled by this value. Use up to max value of 10. Higer values cause jittering/Choppy motion. Min value 1 is for normal motion (Default Value - 3 for stable elements, almost no motion)

*Higer value above 10 till 1000 in AD Macro Motion gives ghosting like Echo images, can be cool for some abstract effects. Sometimes it becomes like deforum img2img animation with consistent jittering background. Try different values for fun. 

*Higer Values than 10 till 200 in macro motion can sometimes experimentally give perfectly still background with good details and good character consistency, you need to find your x value.
